metadata.title: CVE-2022-35737 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
SQLite 1.0.12 through 3.39.x before 3.39.2 sometimes allows an array-boundsoverflow if billions of bytes are used in a string argument to a C API.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-35737` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

lemon - 3.11.0-1ubuntu1.5+esm2
libsqlite3-0 - 3.11.0-1ubuntu1.5+esm2
libsqlite3-tcl - 3.11.0-1ubuntu1.5+esm2
sqlite3 - 3.11.0-1ubuntu1.5+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: sqlite package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and needs fixing.
sqlite3 package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-1ubuntu1.5+esm2').
